The safest sign of regime change is when they start attacking the statues .
Americans , like any other , appreciate Saddam Hussein ’ s carefully staged overthrow in Baghdad in 2003 .

Stephen Miller , one of the key ideologues of the Trump regime , surely knew what he did when he took a symbolic axe in a heated dispute with CNN ’ s Jim Acosta about the president ’ s proposals to curtail legal immigration with a statue of liberty .
To stay fair , Miller did not attack the statue itself .
A horde of boat owners and liberty-imitators would have sounded him if he had done so .
But he attacked their importance , and in particular the importance attributed to her when Emma Lazarus ’ famous poem was added in 1903 , 17 years after the monument ’ s completion .
As Miller Acosta appealed : " I do not want to dwell on a complete thing about history here , but the statue of freedom is ... a symbol of American freedom that enlightened the world .
The poem you refer to was later added and not part of the original statue of liberty . '

It is a question of contemporary resonance at the lofty words of Lazarus , the only one in which a state invites not only any old immigrants , but the poorest of the poor : ' Your mosquitos , your poor , / your afflicted masses who yearn to breathe freely , / the elder waste of your rich coasts ' .

Miller did not engage in literary criticism - he made it clear that these people are not welcome in Trump ’ s US .

Lazarus - and their friends who campaigned to place their words on the base after their death - knew very well that they were carrying out a highly political act .
The sculpture should show the links between French and American Republicanism by portraying the female embodiment of freedom in a used classical visual representation .
Lazarus changed this meaning : in her poem the female figure is no longer abstract - she has received one voice .
And she gives herself a very different name : mother of the exiles .
The connection of the poem with the picture is a brilliant feminist coup and a devastating attack on American nativism .
And just as Lazarus changed the meaning of statue , people from the right wing wanted to change this for a long time .

The great horror of Rush Limbaugh , a kind of John the Baptist for Trump ’ s coming , argued in 2010 that the statue of freedom does not invite anyone , but rather is an early neo-conservative , bringing the American flame into the world that has been transformed : " Lady Liberty is moving forward .

Limbaugh is hardly unusual here .
The importance of the statue is quite a question of the position of perception .
The great imaginative act of Lazarus was to see them as seen by the exhausted , elder but hopeful people after long and often terrible journeys on the deck of ships .
It is really a question of seeing the world from the perspective of people seeking refuge and an opportunity to improve their lives .
Their statue speaks to them the words of hope and will they have to hear .

It is a rare insight into daily life in the highlands of Papua , a former Dutch colony , which was incorporated in Indonesia in 1969 after a controversial referendum , when only 1,026 elders were to vote by a public handing over to the occupying forces .

An existing movement that incited independence against Dutch rule quickly turned against the Jakarta government , which maintains control of the region , excluding foreign journalists or legal observers .
